intro: Asystasia oppositiflora, commonly known as the opposite-flowered asystasia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or violet in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Asystasia oppositiflora is cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
